output_list.reason: The vulnerability exists in the line `balanceOf[0x0] += burnPerTransaction;`. If the sum exceeds the maximum value representable by the `uint256` type (`2^256 - 1`), it causes an integer overflow. This bypasses the subsequent `require` check, leading to unauthorized deductions and logical inconsistencies.

The vulnerability exists in the line `balanceOf[_to] += _value;`. If the sum exceeds the maximum value representable by the `uint256` type (`2^256 - 1`), it causes an integer overflow. This bypasses the subsequent `require` check, leading to unauthorized deductions and logical inconsistencies.

The vulnerability exists in the line `balanceOf[_from] -= _value + burnPerTransaction;`. If the sum exceeds the maximum value representable by the `uint256` type (`2^256 - 1`), it causes an integer overflow. This bypasses the subsequent `require` check, leading to unauthorized deductions and logical inconsistencies.

The vulnerability exists in the line `balanceOf[0x0] += burnPerTransaction;`. If the sum exceeds the maximum value representable by the `uint256` type (`2^256 - 1`), it causes an integer overflow. This bypasses the subsequent `require` check, leading to unauthorized deductions and logical inconsistencies.

The vulnerability exists in the line `balanceOf[_to] += _value;`. If the sum exceeds the maximum value representable by the `uint256` type (`2^256 - 1`), it causes an integer overflow. This bypasses the subsequent `require` check, leading to unauthorized deductions and logical inconsistencies.
